ap_title: Integrated stop smoking services across the Local Maternity System
ap_text: Integrated stop smoking services across the Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity System
success: Maternity partners across the Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity System work together to enhance integrated stop smoking support for mothers and families.
progress: SES LMS Maternal Smoking meeting in July communicated effective models and maternal data systems to inform materniy smoking support and commissioning.  Exploring how integrated maternity opt-out model can be developed in West Sussex
hic_label: Working in partnership is the building block for success

ap_title: Pilot project 'Actively Quitting' using physical activity as a diversion
ap_text: Pilot project 'Actively Quitting' using physical activity as a diversion
success: Smokers will be referred from SSS to leisure provision
progress: Failed to recruit but hoping to utilise stop smoking service to recruit if possible
hic_label: Working in partnership is the building block for success

ap_title: Promote e-cigarettes as a safer and healthier alternative to smoking
ap_text: Promote e-cigarettes as a safer and healthier alternative to smoking. Work with Public Health 'approved' Vape Shops to give vouchers to bed bound clients
success: Increase in number of bed bound smokers using E-cigs instead of cigarettes
progress: Specialist home visiting staff always promote e-cigarettes as a safer alternative. The partnership work with Vape Shops forms part of the longer term aspirations as part of a three year plan. We are currently in year 1.
hic_label: Working in partnership is the building block for success

ap_title: Greater sharing of intelligence to Trading Standards
ap_text: Greater sharing of intelligence to Trading Standards
success: Increase of intel reports to Trading Standards
progress: There has been a 1% increase in intel reports
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Enhanced maternity dataset
ap_text: Enhanced maternity dataset ensuring smoking status recorded for all pregnant women
success: All hospitals within the local LMS footprint collect and report data.
progress: Prevention and data recommendations provided to SES LMS Dashboard to support development and improvement of prevention information within maternity dataset. Maternity services adapting to 2019 update to Better Births  maternal stop smoking procedure and data collection .All maternity services are capturing booking data but either failing NHS digital data quality or not submitting data for SATOD. This is largely an issue with mandatory fields within MIS and also training needs to raise profile of importance of discussing maternal smoking and accurate data reporting.
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Improve data capturing from stop smoking services
ap_text: Improve data capturing from stop smoking services
success: Improved data quality to understand service delivery and  targeting
progress: There is a new data monitoring form for GP practices and new pharmoutcomes template for pharmacies. More rigourous processes are also in place for monitoring data returns and incomplete data are being returned to be resubmitted.
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_title: Produce smoking cessation gap analysis and action plan
ap_text: Produce smoking cessation gap analysis and action plan, based on NICE guidance (PH26) and CLeaR Assessment
success: Maternity systems demonstrate enhanced stop smoking support and pathways in line with NICE guidance and CLeaR Assessments
progress: CLeaR Assessment completed 2018 WaSH catchment. All maternity services are now NICE compliant since Dec 2018 for CO testing. Maternity mandated training update provided to LMS. Prevntion group in June 2018.  Maternity leads Identifying/delivering actions to develop integrated maternal smoking support through training
hic_label: Gather and use the full range of data to inform tobacco control

ap_text: Report on the number of people signposted to stop smoking services from wellbeing hubs
success: Awareness of local smoking population data collected and shared
progress: Smoking status recorded on database referred to community providers-  Stop smoking service soon to be in house.

ap_text: Share data gathered from health MOTs to show the number of people identified as smokers
success: Awareness of local smoking population data collected and shared
progress: Smoking status recorded on database referred to community providers-  Stop smoking service soon to be in house.

ap_text: Smoking status of all pregnant women captured at time of booking and delivery (mandatory)
success: Accurate data recorded and shared

ap_title: Hold stop smoking surgeries in targetted community locations
ap_text: Hold stop smoking surgeries in community locations, specifically in disadvantaged wards
success: Increase in the number of smokers accessing stop smoking services from deprived areas
partners: Wellbeing programme, Primary Care. IPEH Hubs, Voluntary Sectore Organisations, District & Boroughs, Public Health
progress: Focus on  districts where prevalence is higher or number of prvoders lower. In addition to Wellbeing Hub providers being established in these areas, four additional community providers have also been established since the start of the year.
hic_label: Use tobacco control to tackle health inequalities

ap_title: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns
ap_text: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns
success:
Evaluation of campaign reach which increases year on year. Stoptober campaign promoted in Children and Family Centres and Find it out YP Service.
Evaluation of campaign assessed by service user feedback.
Families signed up for Family Assist receive timed Stoptober information.
Lullaby Trust Safer Sleep Campaign is promoted by the Children’s Workforce in March. Smoking cessation is part of this campaign.
partners: Wellbeing programme, Health4Families, Trading Standards, District & Boroughs, Public Health
progress: Comms plan ongoing. Partners to add suggestions. WSCC communities working on a strategy to work alongside Public Health and D&B Councils.
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Annual campaign community event
ap_text: Actively participate in national and local tobacco control campaigns through at least one annual campaign community event organised by 10 fire stations and through social media
success: Evaluation of campaign reach, which increases year on year
progress: No Smoking Day in March is scheduled for annual campaign activity.
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Identify approaches that best serve different communities
ap_text: Identify approaches to disemminating smokefree messages that best serve different communities
success: Engagement with  BAME groups , particularly Eastern European to gain insight into attitudes towards tobacco use
progress: Tried approaching ACCORD To support with this but they are unable to. Need to rethink approach
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Lead on tobacco control communication and campaigns
ap_text: Lead on tobacco control communication and campaigns
success: A communication plan for the period of this strategy is produced
progress: Draft comms plan ready.
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Provide evidence based information via Family Assist
ap_text: Provision of evidence based and consistent information, including on smoking cessation, to all families across West Sussex, via an easily accessed and interactive digital platform (Family Assist)
success: Family Assist achieves high levels of engagement with mothers and families in the provision of comprehensive pre-conception guidance, including on stop smoking information
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust, Sussex Community NHS Foundation Trust, West Sussex County Council
progress: Family Assist has always and continues to provide information on smoking and smoke free homes as routine to all registered users so in reality, The only future changes that will be made to this is the improvement of that information and resource material.
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Distribute 5,000 Safe and Well information booklets
ap_text: Distribute 5,000 Safe and Well information booklets to residents receiving a Safe and Well visit. Booklets include information on smoking related fires, how to make a home smoke free and where to go for smoking cessation support.
success: 5,000 booklets will be disctributed to vulnerable people in their homes
progress: The new Safe and Well information booklet was expected to be released in April, unfortunately it was held up due to copyright issues.  It started to be issued to residents by the specialist home visiting staff at the beginning of July.  It will be issued by crews in August once training in its use has been delivered. Distribution figures will be available one month in arrears.
hic_label: Deliver Consistent, coherent and coordinated communication

ap_title: Wellbeing programme that supports tobacco control
ap_text: Develop the role of the wellbeing programme to support tobacco control
success: West Sussex wellbeing programmes are more engaged in tobacco control
progress: Welbeing staff are trained to deliver SSS.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Redesign stop smoking service provision in West Sussex
ap_text: Redesign stop smoking service provision in West Sussex
success: Effective stop smoking services reaching those that most need to access them
progress: Redesign in progress for new service from april 2020.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Work with Vape shops to support stop smoking providers in primary care
ap_text: Work with Vape shops to support stop smoking providers
success: Improved quit rates. Increased comfidence in stop smoking providers to discuss vaping as a mtehod to quit tobacco
progress: Specification for working with vape shops agreed to start on coastal strip. Face to face and online training include ecigs advice also fact sheets on wellbeing website.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Patients are asked about their use of tobacco at pre-assessment clinics
ap_text: All patients attending pre assessment clinic are asked about their use of tobacco. Smokers are given brief advice and signposted to local stop smoking services
success: Increase  in number of elective patients being signposted to stop smoking services
partners: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
progress: Currently 85%, we anticipate compliance will improve when whole pre-assessment process is recorded  electronically – go live is early August.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Develop a Patient Group Directive around Champix prescribing
ap_text: Develop a Patient Group Directive around Champix prescribing
success: Improved quit rates in pharmacy providers
progress: Unable to develop appropriate governance route at present
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Improve quality of stop smoking service delivery
ap_text: Improve quality of stop smoking service delivery
success: Improved conversion rates
progress: Priority scoring tool used to identify providers who may require additional support to improve service quality. Recorded site visits based on this and reduction in scoring proof additional support/training has been effective. Of 17 providers visited last quarter 15 have reduced scoring post visit.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Improved training offer for stop smoking services
ap_text: Improve training offer for providers of stop smoking services
success: Face to face training for new advisors in place and be spoke elearning package for top up training
progress: Two training sessions have taken place, with 28 attendees in total. Training sessions for the remainder of the year have been organised and are now live on the Learning and Development Gateway for bookings.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Referral and follow up to stop smoking services
ap_text: Referral and follow up to stop smoking services whether the stop smoking intervention is inhouse or external
success: Drop in number of pregnant women still smoking at time of delivery compared to booking
progress: Progress unknown
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Test an integrated midwifery-led stop smoking service
ap_text: Test an integrated tier 2 midwifery led stop smoking support service
success: Increase in maternal quit rates between booking and delivery. Shared and integrated learning across Sussex and East Surrey Local Maternity Systems
progress: Integrated midwifery-led stop smoking service business case presented to LMS group.  Reviewing feedback.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Preventing ill health from alcohol and tobacco CQUIN

success: Local NHS Trusts have achieved the CQUIN
progress: Engaged with WSHT to progress CQUIN

ap_title: Training for primary care staff to deliver stop smoking services
ap_text: Provide training for primary care staff to deliver stop smoking services
success: Primary care staff are able to deliver stop smoking services
progress: Record training attendance, new and exsisting: 9 trained on 22nd March,  18 trained in June. Next training session on 23rd July
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Work with primary care service providers to improve services delivered
ap_text: Work with primary care service providers to improve quantity and quality of services delivered
success: More stop smoking services within primary care
progress: Improved training provision with F2F training, as well as development of additional online training support (onclick). This allows trained providers to refresh knowledge when required. Provider forums also gives good basis for providers to network and keep up to date with industry trends and developments.
hic_label: An integrated stop smoking approach

ap_title: Home visiting staff trained in Make Every Contact Count (MECC)
ap_text: Train Prevention Team home visiting staff in Make Every Contact Count (MECC)
success: Staff will be more confident in having signposting conversations about smoking cessation and making a record
progress: Specialist home visiting staff have already completed on-line Make Every Contact Count training. Face to Face training will be scheduled for Q3&4 this year.
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: Rollout Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to 30% of operational crews
ap_text: Work with the Fire and Rescue Training and Development team to roll out Make Every Contact Count (MECC) to 30% of operational crews
success: 30% of operational personnel will be more confident in having signposting conversations about smoking cessation and recording
progress: The FRS is about to recruit two additional trainer posts who will be expected to work with Public Health to develop and deliver this training to be rolled out commencing next year.
hic_label: Build and sustain capacity in tobacco control

ap_title: A Local Maternity System (LMS) wide action plan
ap_text: A Local Maternity System (LMS) wide action plan will be developed

progress:
Action plan developed. Includes: 1) Continue to raise importance of data quality
2) Continue to review and respond to training position
3) Review feedback and explore fundiung for integrated midwifery stop smoking service
